  Source   Edit

Finite State Machine-based animator module.

Types

ActionId = string
  Source   Edit 
AnimatedEntity = object
  animator: AnimatorId
  currentAnim: AnimationId
  currentStep: int
  currentFrame: int
  pendingTransition: Transition
  previousAnimation: seq[AnimationId]
An entity which can be animated.   Source   Edit 
AnimatedEntityId = string
  Source   Edit 
Animation = object
  id: AnimationId
  indexes: seq[int]
  framesPerStep: int
  transitions: CritBitTree[Transition]
  case animEnd: AnimationEnd
  of GoTo:
      goToState: AnimationId

  else:
      nil
Animation data (each animation is a state in the FSM).   Source   Edit 
AnimationEnd {.pure.} = enum
  NoExit,                   ## Stop the animation
  Loop,                     ## Loop it
  ReturnToPrevious,         ## Return to the animation that was playing before
  GoTo                       ## Transition to a specific animation
What to do after the animation ends.   Source   Edit 
AnimationId = string
  Source   Edit 
Animator = CritBitTree[Animation]
  Source   Edit 
AnimatorId = string
  Source   Edit 
Transition = object
  flags: set[TransitionFlag]
  to: AnimationId
A transition between animations.   Source   Edit 
TransitionFlag = enum
  Immediate,                ## Transition without waiting for the current animation to end
  Interrupting               ## Don't save the current animation as previous
Different flags for transitions.   Source   Edit

Procs

proc addAnimatedEntities(base: AnimatedEntityId; count: int;
                         animator: AnimatorId; startAnim: AnimationId): seq[
    AnimatedEntityId] {.inline, ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Creates multiple animated entities at once, assigning their ids using newArrayId. Returns the ids of created entities.   Source   Edit 
proc addAnimatedEntity(id: AnimatedEntityId; animator: AnimatorId;
                       startAnim: AnimationId) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new animated entity with a given id, specifies its animator and the initial animation it starts from.   Source   Edit 
proc addAnimation(id: AnimatorId; anim: AnimationId; indexes: openArray[int];
                  framesPerStep: int; animEnd: AnimationEnd) {.
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Add an animation to the animator.
id:
The animator you are adding the animation to.
anim:
Name of the animation.
indexes:
Which sprites (indexes) should the animation contain and in what order.
framesPerStep:
How many frames should pass for every step in the animation.
animEnd:
What to do after the animation ends.

See also:

  • addAnimation proc
  Source   Edit 
proc addAnimation[H, U: Ordinal](id: AnimatorId; anim: AnimationId;
                                 indexes: HSlice[H, U]; framesPerStep: int;
                                 animEnd: AnimationEnd) {.inline.}
A version of addAnimation proc where you specify a range instead of a sequence of indexes.   Source   Edit 
proc addAnimator(id: AnimatorId) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Register a new Animator.   Source   Edit 
proc addTransition(id: AnimatorId; fromAnim, toAnim: AnimationId;
                   action: ActionId; flag: TransitionFlag) {.inline,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Version of addTransition that takes only a single flags.   Source   Edit 
proc addTransition(id: AnimatorId; fromAnim, toAnim: AnimationId;
                   action: ActionId; flags: set[TransitionFlag] = {}) {.inline,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Adds a new transition to the animation.
id:
Animator in question.
fromAnim:
Animation, from which the transition will happen
toAnim:
Animation, to which the transition will happen
action:
Action, in response to which the transition happens (see notifyAction proc)
flags:
Additional flags
  Source   Edit 
proc delete(id: AnimatedEntityId) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Deletes the animated entity.   Source   Edit 
proc deleteAll(base: AnimatedEntityId) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Delete all the entities generated with a prefix

  Source   Edit 
proc getIndex(id: AnimatedEntityId): int {.inline, ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Get current index (usually a sprite index in the spritesheet) for the entity.   Source   Edit 
proc newArrayId(base: AnimatedEntityId): AnimatedEntityId {.inline,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}

Helper proc for generating ids for dynamically created entities (such as monsters etc). For each call it simply generates a new id based on the given one by adding a number to it. The numbers for each "array base" are always increasing and are never reused.

See also:

  • restartArrayId proc
  Source   Edit 
proc notifyAction(id: AnimatedEntityId; action: ActionId) {....raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [].}
Send a message (an Action) to the AnimatedEntity. That might trigger a state transition.   Source   Edit 
proc restartArrayId(base: AnimatedEntityId) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Is used to restart the array counter for the newArrayId proc. Use this only if you are sure that there are no entities with these ids left (like after calling deleteAll proc).

See also:

  • newArrayId proc
  Source   Edit 
proc setAnimationStep(id: AnimatedEntityId; step: int) {.inline,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Sets the animation step in the current animation. Could be used to make the animation immediately end, or to desyncronize the animations of multiple entities.   Source   Edit 
proc setGoTo(id: AnimatorId; fromAnim, toAnim: AnimationId) {.inline,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Sets the animation (toAnim) to which the fromAnim should transition after it ends. Is only valid if fromAnim's animEnd was set to AnimationEnd.GoTo.   Source   Edit 
proc updateAnimations() {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Update all the animations. Should be called once per frame.   Source   Edit
